org.hibernate.search.engine.nulls.codec.impl

Interface NullMarkerCodec

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ElasticsearchAsNullNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchAsNullStringNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchAsTokenStringNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchBooleanNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchDoubleNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchFloatNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchIntegerNullMarkerCodec, ElasticsearchLongNullMarkerCodec, LuceneDoubleNullMarkerCodec, LuceneFloatNullMarkerCodec, LuceneIntegerNullMarkerCodec, LuceneLongNullMarkerCodec, LuceneStringNullMarkerCodec, NotEncodingCodec

    public interface NullMarkerCodec
    Contract to manage coding and decoding (querying) of null values. Null values can be stored as special markers or skipping the field altogether. When encoding a marker the index field type shall match the other fields, as field types often need to be consistent across the whole index. Also the strategy to find a match for such a null-encoded value might vary.
    Author:
    Sanne Grinovero

    • Method Detail

      • getNullMarker

        NullMarker getNullMarker()
        Returns:
        The null marker used by this codec.

      • encodeNullValue

        void encodeNullValue(String fieldName,
                     Document document,
                     LuceneOptions luceneOptions)
        Store the null marker in the Document. Some implementations might not do anything
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field
        document - the document where to store the null marker
        luceneOptions - indexing options

      • representsNullValue

        boolean representsNullValue(IndexableField field)
        Check if the field represents the encoding for a null element
        Parameters:
        field - the fields to check
        Returns:
        true if the field argument is representing the encoding for a null element.

      • createNullMatchingQuery

        Query createNullMatchingQuery(String fieldName)
        Create a Query to find all documents which have a 'null' value encoded in the specified field
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field to target with the Query
        Returns:
        a new Lucene Query
